intro: Hieracium salignum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium salignum is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
